item.title: Fave Fonts
item.description: You know we've entered a new era when someone seriously asks writers (Jonathan Lethem, Nicholson Baker, Richard Posner, etc.) to talk about their favorite font. [via]
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: AWOL
item.description: I will be in L.A. for the long weekend, so no updates for a few days... unless, of course, I do coke off a B-celeb's tummy. (I wouldn't tell you if it were an A-celeb. I'm classy like that.)
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Zune
item.description: A few days ago, I took a picture of a "iPod Amnesty Bin" at Zune HQ. It has since exploded as a blogosphere item. Weird how that happens. Update: lookie there, it's now an InfoWorld and PC World story too.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Newsbreaker
item.description: BoingBoing linked to our Newsbreaker game. Yeah!
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Another Onion Link
item.description: The Onion: Dog Breeders Issue Massive Recall Of '07 Pugs.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: EveryBlock
item.description: Dammit, why the hell didn't I submit my idea to the Knight News Challenge? Adrian will be walking away with $1.1 million to start EveryBlock. The winners list looks like a hodgepodge of industry colleagues and friends.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Paris, Je T'Aime
item.description: A bunch of directors (Coen Brothers, Gus Van Sant, Gurinder Chadha, Wes Craven, Walter Salles, Alexander Payne, Olivier Assayas, etc.) and a bunch of actors (Natalie Portman, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Elijah Wood, Nick Nolte, etc.) pay homage to Paris in Paris, Je T'Aime.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Pickupedia
item.description: Nerve.com has started a wiki for pickup lines: Pickupedia. [via]
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Blogging Innocence
item.description: Interesting or fake? Or both? A father suspected of murder is on the run from the law with his son. So what's he do? Of course, he blogs about it.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Jam Glue
item.description: Just discovered JamGlue.com, a site where you upload song snippets, remix them, and redistribute your remixes. Seattle-based.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Passive Aggressive
item.description: Ever been angry with someone and left them a passive-aggressive note? Well, here's the blog for you.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Google Hot Trends
item.description: Google Trends has added a teeny tiny little feature: Hot Trends. Every day, it lists search terms that are on the rise and builds pages around their trending.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: New Media Tuesday
item.description: It's New Releases Tuesday, with my media recommendations for the week. DVD: Mel Gibson's Apocalypto | Music: Battles' Mirrored and The National's Boxer.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Book ARG
item.description: We've seen alternate reality games for movies and for music and for video games, but I believe the game for Steven Hall's The Raw Shark Texts is the first ARG built around a book. The adventure starts at LostEnvelope.com and includes clues left on Flickr, YouTube, and other sites, all ending a real-world prize. More details at Vulture.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Spoilt
item.description: Threadless spoiler tee.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: After Dark
item.description: Over the weekend, I finished the new Murakami novel, which somehow manages to be both tremendously cinematic and wildly unfilmable at the same time. (One of the main characters is actually a camera, which is a proxy for us, the audience. This causes parts of the plot to be told in first-person plural -- "point of view" is a prevailing phrase.) A few reviews: L.A. Times | San Fran Chron | Wash Post.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Jezebel
item.description: New Gawker blog just launched: Jezebel. It's pitching itself as the anti-women's-mag mag. From an email: "Jezebel's mission is to cover celebrity, sex, and fashion for women -- without airbrushing. Think of it as the sort of women's media property that could never see the light of day in traditional print because the big-name advertisers and the publishers who kowtow to them don't much like it when someone points out the vulgarity of a $2,000 handbag." Doy, the editors are hot.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: 50 Best Date Movies
item.description: Nerve: The 50 Best Date Movies Ever. Films I've personally used as clinchers: Heathers (#45) Annie Hall (#34), Rear Window (#30), Chungking Express (#19), Before Sunrise (#10), and Barbarella (#5).
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Creed Thoughts vs. Steven Wright
item.description: Observation: Creed Thoughts is remarkably similar to my Steven Wright Twitter page. But much crazier.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: No More Apprentic
item.description: The Donald quits The Apprentice before NBC can fire him.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Summize
item.description: Summize.com. New search engine that tries to visualize positive/negative product reviews.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Seattle Paperless Media
item.description: For a brief moment on Friday, Seattle was the future of media, as Crosscut published a story that said the Seattle P-I would go e-paper in the next couple years. Unfortunately, the P-I quickly denied it. Shucks.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Minnesota Rollergirls
item.description: Cool Hunting does a five-minute video on the Minnesota Rollergirls. I miss those girls.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Citizen Rain
item.description: My friend Cory has launched a new Seattle blog: Citizen Rain.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Reservoir Dogs
item.description: Just for fun, a random flashback trailer: Reservoir Dogs. Next time you get me drunk, remind me to tell you the story about meeting Mr. Pink during the filming of the movie Fargo.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Automatic Update
item.description: Next month, MoMA opens a digital art retrospective called Automatic Update.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Trailers
item.description: Eli Roth is making a feature film consisting of nothing but trailers, thereby bringing the dreams of every film student undergrad's notion of genius to the big screen.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Human Joysticks
item.description: Another work-related post, but you'll like this one. Remember that NewsBreaker game? As a follow-up, we created "group game" in select movie theaters where the audience collectively plays the game on the movie screen by moving their bodies. CNet has a story about it, but the real action can be seen in this video clip.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: TNG
item.description: I love clips like this: the last 10 seconds of every episodes of the first season of Star Trek: The Next Generation. [via]
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: DIY Porn
item.description: Radar's DIY porn story.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: NILF
item.description: Hilarious Daily Show clip last night: NILF: News I'd Like To Fuck.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Fark
item.description: I'm not sure what to make this: the dude from Fark has written a book (out in couple weeks) subtitled "How Mass Media Tries to Pass Off Crap As News." Isn't that the definition of Fark?
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Kreepie Kats
item.description: Village Voice has a profile of the guy behind Kreepie Kats, a comic strip (sorta) that is my favorite Gawker feature.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Free Wonkette
item.description: The lawsuit against Wonkette from the Washingtonienne scandal has finally been dropped.
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com

item.title: Best and Worst Architecture of Seattle
item.description: Slate (originally founded in Seattle but now based in DC/NYC) has a peculiar little slideshow on The Best and Worst Architecture of Seattle. [via]
item.author: rex@fimoculous.com
